Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm taking some time off from work--well, my other work--because we needed it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The phone has been ringing off the hook. The guys in Philly are kind of going nuts.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But that doesn't matter. This does. It's the only thing that matters. We've had some really nice days together.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nice morning, too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Beesly! Oh, my god.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey. Which tie makes me look like a guy who likes sofas? My agent's putting me up for a furniture commercial.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah, definitely blue.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Totally, right? So, Big Tuna, what's up? Back in the small pond?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: For now, yeah. I was spreading myself way too thin--

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thin-sliced tuna. Carpaccio. Go on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, well, it took me a while, but I finally realized that I can't give 100% to two things at once you know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tell me about it, you know? I've been trying to act and manage this branch. Half the time I don't know if I'm wearing my stage makeup or my work makeup.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Huh. Well, you know, you can't have everything so you gotta ask yourself what makes you the happiest. You just go all in for what's most important. That's my new thing.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [noticing Angela looking very unkempt] Is everything ok?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. Everything is not okay. The county took my cats.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wait, all of them?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Two sacks' worth. Apparently my apartment complex has rules about how many pets are too many for a studio. And while I was out picking Phillip up from daycare, they came. They came into my house.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's--that's awful, Angela. I'm so sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's the [bleep] that lives downstairs. She's this uptight, judgmental shrew. You know the type.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I've never met anyone like that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: And they're gone. And I have no one left. Without my cats, I am utterly and completely alone.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela, you still have your son.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I guess.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Attention, everyone. May I have your attention? There are four new deadly weapons in this office. [kicking and punching] Basher, Thrasher, Crasher and--

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Smasher!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Smasher? No, where'd you get that? Fireball. This morning after hours of combat with some of the city's best teenagers I earned my black belt in Goju Ryu martial arts.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I had to find a new dojo after sensei Ira and I parted ways. My new sensei, sensei Billy, thought I had more than enough training to take the test. Turns out, sensei Ira was a bit of a shyster. Sensei Billy says most students don't spend $150,000 over 20 years to get their black belt.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I would like to invite you all to my black belt ceremony, right here in the office at lunch, lunch not provided.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Fireball!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah! [throws punch] That's how it's done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's pretty good. I feel safe.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Hey, Erin. Is Andy in?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, is Andy in? Sorry, I thought you said "is Indian" and was like, "Is Indian what?" Is Indian food good? Is Indian jewelry pretty? Is Indian hair an expensive kind of wig? Yes, to all three, by the way.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Lately, I've been having a lot of trouble keeping track of Andy's calendar. His student film audition schedule is crazy hectic.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes, there's Andy! Andy is in. I'm a good receptionist, I know he's in.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: David Walrus, in his native habitat.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Hey, Andy. Can we go in your office and talk?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: This isn't going to be an easy conversation. I told Andy that he was on very thin ice when he snuck away from three months to the Caribbean. Then last week he used company money to buy a top-of-the-line photo printer. In his words, "The kind that's good for head shots." And yesterday, he asked me to pay for cheek implants. Claimed it's gonna boost office morale. Now, he's a good guy. But honestly, at some point, the ice gets too thin and you fall through. And that is when you get fired.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Andy--

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm gonna stop you right there. David, this documentary is going to air in two weeks. I feel like it's a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to pursue my dream.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Uh-huh, but--

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Every minute that I spend here is time not spent making audition videos for reality dating, cooking or singing shows. I got a real shot here. And I'll never be able to forgive myself if I blew it because I was too focused on my stupid paper company job. No offense.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: So you think you've been too focused on your job?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: At my last head shot sitting, I was so distracted wondering what I was missing at work that I came across totally manic. And I was going for zany.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: So you--you want to quit Dunder Mifflin to pursue acting?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, no, actually. I see no reason to limit myself to just acting. I am pursuing fame of any kind. Could be singing, could be dancing. I don't--it just... I owe it to myself and my future fans.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Uh, well, I guess I can't stand in the way of a man's dream. And it seems like you have the gift.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you, David.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: There's probably no way I can talk you into staying at this point, can I?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nope. I have made up my mind. I'm really sorry.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Well, good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you. Not gonna need it.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Well that kind of worked out.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I think just anybody could be a star. My postman, the night janitor here, but Andy? No, definitely not. Charisma black hole.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, Clark. I'm actually here today. Surprise! So I was wondering if I could maybe have my desk back.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Right. Yeah. But, you know, I've actually been working pretty hard here on a daily basis. So, I kind of feel like I've earned this. I mean, you know?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You totally have. You have earned this. But maybe I could be with my wife. Kind of the whole reason that I'm here.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Right. Well, I'm here to sell paper.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: All right, Jim, look, I just got made junior salesman. Right? And--and Wallace is here today. And I don't him to just think of me as a customer service rep that sits in the annex. I mean, you can get that, right? Right? And what do you need more face time with Wallace for? You trying to get a second second job here?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: it's okay. You can sit in the annex.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'll come visit you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. The annex it is. I'll be sitting at your desk if that's okay with you.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: That's fine with me. But be careful, it is very easy to get lost in Pete's beautiful, dead eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Everyone, a little breaking news for ya. Just had a little chat with David Wallace. And, um, I'm taking a leave of absence from Dunder Mifflin, forever.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I can't say we didn't see it coming. But it's a sad day when anybody is fired. We're so sorry, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Uh, uh, uh, uh, Andy was not fired.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I wasn't fired. What are you talking about? I'm fired up, yes. Guys, I'm--I'm leaving to pursue my lifelong dream of being famous.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, so, I'll see you on the red carpet. See, that's how it works.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Andy sings beautifully. And he's really good at dancing. He's a good speaker. But there's just something there you don't want to look at.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, how am I doing as your desk mate, by the way? You probably miss Clark.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah, a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, wow. But, um--Oh, I get that.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no, no. No it's cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I get it.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: It's cool, man. I'm sure you and I will have our own thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Definitely. Go Phillies, right. You don't watch baseball. I keep forgetting that.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I just think you're going into this a little fast.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm 38, Darryl, how much slower should I go?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Show business is cold. Let's say you get a job, which you probably won't. They're not gonna cut you any slack. You're meant for a job with lots and lots of slack.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right. I get it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The male is a funny species. We don't just tell each other how we feel, that's chick stuff. So instead of saying, "Hey, Andy, I love you, man. I don't want you to leave." You say something like, "Hey, Andy, you're making the worst mistake of your life. You're not talented." Well... right back at you, Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [hugs Darryl] I'm gonna miss you too. Mmm!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Andy's from the generation that thinks they should all be famous. What happened to the generation that knew you shut up, did your work, and died quietly from a heart attack?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Could Andy make it as an entertainer? I don't know. You know who's really funny? This bird, in the park, that can't fly right. I'd pay to see him. But I don't have to cause the park is free!

Quote.Speaker: Sensei
Quote.Text: I will now perform the ceremonial changing of the belts.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He will now perform the ceremonial changing of the belts!

Quote.Speaker: Sensei
Quote.Text: It's not a large room, I think they heard me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Take my belt, master. I now submit to you every part of myself. [thrusts hips at Ira]

Quote.Speaker: Sensei
Quote.Text: That's really ok. I'm mostly focused on the belt here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just slip it off my--Slip it off my hips.

Quote.Speaker: Sensei
Quote.Text: Hold it--Take a step back. Take a step back. [they bow, then Dwight thrusts again] Okay, okay. I can't--I can't do this if you're gonna be thrusting like that, okay? I think we're gonna have to cut this off.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He will now perform the ceremonial cutting-off-of-the-belt.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight has been practicing karate for years. When we were dating, I would help him with his strength training. He would strap me to his chest in a baby Bjorn made for fat children and do lunges across the farm. It felt like I was flying.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There it is. [everyone applauds]

Quote.Speaker: Sensei
Quote.Text: Congratulations.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We did it, we did it. I love you.

Quote.Speaker: Sensei
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thanks. I will now perform my final kata forms. You're gonna watch me right?

Quote.Speaker: Sensei
Quote.Text: Yes, I will. [Dwight starts doing karate]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sensei, you're not watching.

Quote.Speaker: Sensei
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm watching. Just do it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Watching?

Quote.Speaker: Sensei
Quote.Text: I'm watching.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Watch this part, okay?

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Sensei, do you generally do house calls like this?

Quote.Speaker: Sensei
Quote.Text: Uh, you can just call me Billy. And no. No, but Dwight insisted. He wanted to receive his black belt in the place he loves most in the world.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: He said that? He's an odd guy, isn't he?

Quote.Speaker: Sensei
Quote.Text: Yes. Irritating, also yes. But I gotta hand it to him, he's one of the most tenacious and determined men I've ever met. [Dwight finishes his routines and everyone applauds]

Quote.Speaker: Esther
Quote.Text: Oh! I'm am so proud of you, Schru-berry blue.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I really felt like I almost lost her, and--and nothing is worth that.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Well, I gotta tell you, Jim, a lot of guys in my circle? They wouldn't even change their golf schedule to shore up their marriage let alone their professional goals.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Dude, there is no way that Jim is just back here to hang out with Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You did not just say that! You don't know Pam. She is really cool.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: All I'm saying is, forget about my chair. He wants the manager's chair. And I thought you wanted that job.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, I did. But I made too many mistakes. It's out of my reach now. Besides, I think Jim would be a fine manager. I'd be happy to see Jim as manager.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: So, the reason that I called you in here is because Andy is moving on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Again.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Again! And I'm looking for a new manager. And with his performance this year, I have been considering Dwight. Am I crazy?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not at all. It should be Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: You sure?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're gonna want to invest in a lot more liability insurance, but, uh--

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, if there is someone out there who loves paper more than Dwight, I definitely don't want to meet that person.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Andy, we just wondered if we could have a word.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's now or never.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, we just had a quick question about this decision of yours. You know, to leave a stable job and pursue a career in the entertainment business. In your late 30s. With no savings to fall back on. And no real connections in that business, which can be competitive.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, sure. What's your question?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Our question is--it seems dumb.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, it's better than sticking around here and half-assing it, right?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Of course. But what if you were to stay here, you know, and "full-ass" it? Um, really give it a go. Be the greatest manager in the history of this branch and in that way achieve the fame and immortality that you seek. Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nah. I like my plan better.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, Andy, your plan sucks, okay? Nobody is going to hire you ever. You're too character-y to be a lead and you're not fat enough to be a great character actor.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, I don't think that he can make it as an actor. But, he also can't make it as an employee in an office, so why not go nuts with it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, are you still in charge of office supplies?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I seem to have sticky not emergency where I grab it on the wrong end, and this happens.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, boy. Um--

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If you could help me out, that would be--

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I could give you some beginner stickies?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Anything would help.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here you go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, also, while you're at it, if you did have a salt packet, three tacks and some aspirin, that would be great. Oh, wow. You have that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, that's--

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's all yours.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You come so prepared. Aspirin.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You wanna get rid of a headache, you sit on something sharp. Any sensei will tell you that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, congratulations on that black belt, man. It's really great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you. So I saw you talking to Wallace earlier. Is he going to offer you the manager's job?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. He was maybe thinking of you for it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, right. I'm afraid that ship has sailed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I wouldn't be too sure about that. Just saying.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, hello.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Big day for you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Big day for you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Love the belt.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know, I don't know anything about karate but I have broken a few boards in my day. Diving boards, at my family pool in Redding. I was an obese child. I never talk about that here, but Nard-dog's outta here, so letting it all hang out!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is exciting! You're finally gonna get to go out and flap your wings.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you, I appreciate that. 'Cause a lot of people are saying I might not make it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, I doubt you'll make it. Very few do who've tried to be a star. But, listen, you've saved up enough money to take a couple of years off to pursue your dream and have some fun, right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, I just applied for more overdraft protection.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Andy, I have nothing to gain from getting you to stay, and everything to gain from you leaving. But please, I have known you for years, I have seen you perform. Dear god, don't quit your day job.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [cockney accent] Nothing is impossible to him who will try. [normal] Alexander the Great, if he were cockney.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're bad.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm gonna make it. Every person that has been on Conan has a crazy story about how they made it. Every person.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Erin. Honest Erin, cannot tell a lie. We lay together. That's something you can't take back.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: So true. Is there a question, or are--what?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Will you tell me bluntly, do you think I am making a terrible mistake quitting my job to become an actor?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Bluntly? Yes. Huge mistake. Andy, honestly, I think you might become homeless. Or maybe even starve.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you. [steps into conference room]

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: You can stay on as a salesman, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Dwight, could you come in here for a second, please?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Say it again.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Will you be the new manager?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where?

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Where?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What branch?

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Here. Scranton. [Dwight falls to his knees] Come on. Come on, Dwight. Get up. Let's go. It's good news.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. I've just waited for this moment my entire life. I mean, I was interim manager once, but then I shot that gun.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But this isn't interim manager. No. It's Dwight K. Schrute... [pulls a business card out of his wallet] Manager.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Why do you already have this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In case Michael or Andy ever got killed in a traffic accident and there was a trade show on the same day. You will not regret this decision, David.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will never, ever let you down.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: I know, Dwight. I know. [reaches out to shake Dwight's hand, Dwight hugs him] Okay. Okay. All righty. You're gonna do great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, I have a question.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I had a question.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I did!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, totally you did.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Super important.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I need you to stay right here while you think about it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right? I'm gonna wait.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: All right. I did not come back here just to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sure you did not. What was your question?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know, but it might take me a long time to figure it out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, then, I should figure out things to do while I'm waiting.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, everybody, I changed my mind. Not leaving. I'm gonna stay on in sales.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, thank god. Because sales could be your best role yet.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, good choice, man. Seriously. Don't want to see you in a porn next year.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ooh, there's a great play about a salesman.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Death of a salesman.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sure, 'Death of a Salesman' by Arthur Miller, it's a great play about crushed dreams.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, this one was written by Spongebob Squarepants.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [sits at Dwight's desk] Got any hot leads?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: See, so you just push from under, and turn it around, and boom. No the staple crimps outward.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I had no idea. And here I've been stapling the same way for 20 years like a frickin' sheep.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Look who's back.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm back. Oh, hey, look, and now it's like a double date.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Wow. Cause, uh [gestures to him and Erin and then to Pam and Jim with sound effects]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Actually, maybe we should go on a double date some time. That'd be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, we should do that for real sometime.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, how about Thursday?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, well, Thursday's tough, because of--

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Weeknights are actually tough just because--

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They are.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's true, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Just forget it. Forget I said anything.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Attention, everyone, just a quick announcement. Little reconfiguration to the staff. Dwight Schrute--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: David. Can I just do one thing while you're making this announcement and then I'll never, ever do it again?

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's just one thing. Just let me--let me do this--

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Dwight, Dwight, Dwight. Come on--what I was about to say was Dwight--[phone buzzes] Oh, I'm sorry, I gotta--This'll be a second, sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just wait and send it to voicemail.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: [on phone] Then we'll get him a new set of drums.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [climbs up on desk] Dwight Schrute is manager! [everyone cheers and applauds]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Brava, brava.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [from atop his desk] Creed Bratton is the new manager! [nobody responds]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Dwight's the new manager. He freaking did it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [hugs Dwight] Congratulations, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [hugs Dwight] Congratulations, buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Congrats, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get out of Jim's seat.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: But I fought for this seat.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're an annex kid. You might be bullpen, we'll see. Give it a couple of years. Scram.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's nice to have you back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I wanted to offer you a new position.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let's hear it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Assistant regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. Can't accept that job. It's not a real job.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll tell you what I could accept is assistant to the regional manager. That is a real job and one I'd be proud to take.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shake on it? Done. Way to negotiate, idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Don't get me wrong, I am definitely here for Pam. But this is an awesome added bonus.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, all the numbers adding up?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, I didn't get a chance to say it, but... congratulations, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes. Congratulations.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, and Dwight, I'd like to be the first to say congratulations.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This is a big day for you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, it is. Carry on.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: How did I just abandon my dreams so quickly? It's cause I had a fallback. That's the problem. When you have fallbacks, it's just easy to give up. When Cortez landed in Mexico, only way he got his men to defeat the Aztecs was by burning all of his own boats. So they could never return home. Huge dick move but very effective. I need to be that same kind of dick to myself.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Everyone! Changed my mind again.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What's it now, dream or no dream?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, dream. Goin' with my dream. Gotta go all in, isn't that right, Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, don't look at me cause I think you're making a terrible choice.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All in! Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Toby! Hey, I changed my mind again. I am gonna leave Dunder Mifflin to pursue acting after all.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay, then, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, but here's the thing. I can't have good old Dunder Mifflin to fall back on or else I'll never succeed. Gotta burn those boats! So I need you to go into my file and put down that I was fired for theft and/or groping wieners.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Andy, you know I can't do that. It'd be lying.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Seriously?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm--

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Come on, just do it.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I can't.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right, fine, just know that you made me do this. [starts touching Toby's thighs]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [fending Andy off] Oh, come on. Andy, no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: God, Toby, don't--stop blocking my hand.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is your--you brought this on.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, no. Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, all right. Groped you good. Off to Hollywood!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [answering phone] This is Angela. Oh. Hello, Miss Polodnikovski. Uh, how can I help you? Did my rent check not clear? Because I just transferred another $25 to that account. So if there's a problem it's clearly on your end. And--oh. Oh. Oh, okay. Good. Then... um... what is this about? No, no. Hey, hey! No, you are out of line Miss Polodnikovski. No, no you are. No you are! Evicted? Fine! I didn't want to live in that cesspool anyway! Listen, I get my security deposit back. Yes, I do. This is not fair! That is not fair! Well, you know what? You have so many hairs on your chin that Animal Control should've taken you away. That is very unladylike! You are disgusting! [hangs up phone]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What do you think that was about?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: David. I lost the Scranton White Pages account. Do you have any idea how much paper that is? And I'd just like to point out, I was mad at Dwight. I did it out of spite.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: We put the past behind us, though, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What if I told you that I hate you and I hate this company?

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Enough, Andy. Enough!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Just stop forgiving me, David, please? This is my last chance to honor what is best inside myself. What if I took a dump on your new car?

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Oh my god.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Eleanor Roosevelt once said 'the future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.' [clip of him flipping off David Wallace] I think she's right. [clip of David Wallace yelling at Andy to get out] I feel calm now. [clip of Andy taking a dump on a car] I feel, like, for the first time in a long time, I'm doing the right thing.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, heavy stuff like books on the bottom. So it don't squash my knickety-knacks on top.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah, okay. That's not what I mean. You don't have to leave because you said you would. Don't let pride ruin your whole life. Okay? It's not worth it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow. Angela. What we had was great, and, honestly I think about it a lot too--

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: But I just--it's in the past. And I feel like we shouldn't...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, that's not--

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Rehash--

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, none--No, stop. It's just--

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay. Well, have a good trip. Good luck, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thanks, Angela. You too.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A-bridge, a-burnt. No turning back now. Everybody, Lorelai and I would like to say thank you and goodbye the only way we know how.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, good lord.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Can't you just leave?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, Andy, you could just say a really nice goodbye.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tuna, I'm a performer. And perform I shall. [sings 'I Will Remember You'--everyone is slightly impressed]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispering] You okay?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [crying] It's just a really nice song.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [everyone applauding] Awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Who knows? Maybe Andy will make it. He's not terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Yeah. And people worse than him make it all the time. Like Lil Romeo.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No, he's good.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: He was good.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Good night, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Night, Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Tents? Are you thinking of going camping? I thought you found nature vulgar.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, I've changed my mind.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Wait a minute. You're not thinking of living in a--

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, god, could you just mind your own business?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm just gonna say this. You are not going to live in a tent.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, god.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Come stay with me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You don't want me at your place.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I do. Yes. Not forever. But until you get back on your feet. Which won't be long. It's the least I could do.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Separate bathrooms.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're welcome. Let's go get Phillip. Then we'll get your stuff...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: And get you the hell outta that place.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Are you allowed to have pets?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh, Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yesterday I was just your average, ordinary paper salesman with a farm and a bunch of pipe dreams about beet fuel. Today, I leave here a regional manager with a black belt. It really is amazing how your life can change in one day.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You talk to Wade and Colin?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I just saw I missed their call. Why? What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: We got an offer on the table.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What kind of offer?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: A buyout.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: We're in play, baby.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, my god!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: We did it! Hey, and look, the buyers wanna make sure it's not just a Philly play, so get this: they're gonna pay for us to go pitch out west. We talking Spurs, the Jazz, Cowboys. Blake Griffin, baby.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, that is... wow.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, we did it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, we did. Hey, how long--how long do we think that's gonna take?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Wade said we could do the whole country in three months.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, man. Yeah, I can't do it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Can't do what?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This, man. I can't do this to Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, no, Jim. This is different. This is everything.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know. And I can't do it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: So is your place all bachelor-slobby and gross?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, it's neat and tasteful, like most gay men's homes. The stereotype holds up.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I wouldn't know. I never lived with a gay guy.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela, you just were--

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [starts sobbing] I love him.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I know. I understand more than most, but we both have to move on. You--you can't--

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, not the senator. I love Dwight.
